check.label: Recompile if switches changed
check.tip: Recompile if compiler switches have changed since last compilation

check.label: Minimal recompilation
check.tip: Specifies that the minimum necessary amount of recompilation be performed. In this mode, gnatmake ignores time stamp differences when the only modification to a source file consist in adding or removing comments, empty lines, spaces or tabs

spin.label: Multiprocessing
spin.tip: Use N processes to carry out the compilations. On a multiprocessor machine compilations will occur in parallel

check.label: Keep going
check.tip: Continue as much as possible after a compilation error

check.label: Debug information
check.tip: Add debugging information. This forces the corresponding switch for the compiler, binder and linker

check.label: Use mapping file
check.tip: Use a mapping file. A mapping file is a way to communicate to the compiler two mappings: from unit name to file names, and from file names to path names. This will generally improve the compilation time

check.label: Inlining
check.tip: Enable inlining of Ada subprograms marked with a pragma Inline

check.label: Unroll loops
check.tip: Perform the optimization of loop unrolling. This is only done for loops whose number of iterations can be determined at compile time or run time

check.label: Position independent code
check.tip: If supported for the target machine, emit position-independent code, suitable for dynamic linking and avoiding any limit of the size of the global offset table

check.label: Code coverage
check.tip: Create data files for the gcov code-coverage utility

check.label: Instrument arcs
check.tip: Instrument arcs during compilation. For each function of your program, gcc creates a program flow graph, then finds a spanning tree for the graph. Only arcs that are not on the spanning tree have to be instrumented: the compiler adds code to count the number of times that these arcs are executed

check.label: Always generate ALI file
check.tip: Don't quit, write ali/tree file even if compile errors

check.label: Separate function sections
check.tip: Generate each function in a separate section. See also -fdata-sections and --gc-sections linker flag

check.label: Separate data sections
check.tip: Generate each global data in a separate section. See also -ffunction-sections and --gc-sections linker flag

check.label: Full errors
check.tip: Full Errors. Multiple errors per line, all undefined references

check.label: Constant conditional
check.tip: Activates warnings for conditional expression used in tests that are known to be True or False at compile time

check.label: Implicit dereference
check.tip: If set, the use of a prefix of an access type in an indexed component, slice or selected component without an explicit .all will generate a warning. With this warning enabled, access checks occur only at points where an explicit .all appears

check.label: Warnings=Errors
check.tip: Causes warning messages to be treated as errors

check.label: Unreferenced formal
check.tip: Causes warnings to be generated if a formal parameter is not referenced in the body

check.label: Hiding variable
check.tip: This switch activates warnings on hiding declarations. A declaration is considered hiding if it is for a non-overloadable entity, and if it declares an entity with the same name as some other entity that is directly or use-visible

check.label: Implementation unit
check.tip: This switch activates warnings for a with of an internal GNAT implementation unit

check.label: Missing elaboration pragma
check.tip: This switch activates warnings on missing pragma Elaborate_All statements

check.label: Address clause overlay
check.tip: This switch activates warnings for possible unintended initialization effects of defining address clauses that cause one variable to overlap another

check.label: Ineffective pragma inline
check.tip: This switch activates warnings for a failure of front end inlining to inline a particular call

check.label: Redundant construct
check.tip: This switch activates warnings for redundant constructs: - Assignment of an item to itself - Type conversion that converts an expression to its own type - ...

check.label: Unused entity
check.tip: This switch activates warnings to be generated for entities that are defined but not referenced

check.label: Checking for copies
check.tip: The right hand side of assignments, and the initializing values of object declarations are validity checked

check.label: Checking for 'in' parameters
check.tip: Arguments for parameters of mode in are validity checked in function and procedure calls at the point of call

check.label: Checking for 'in out' parameters
check.tip: Arguments for parameters of mode in out are validity checked in procedure calls at the point of call

check.label: Checking for operators and attributes
check.tip: Arguments for predefined operations and attributes are validity checked

check.label: Checking for returns
check.tip: The expression in return statements in functions is validity checked

check.label: Checking for subscripts
check.tip: All subscripts expressions are checked for validty

check.label: Checking for tests
check.tip: Expressions used as conditions in if, while or exit statements are checked, as well as guard expressions in entry calls

check.label: Check subprogram bodies in alphabetical order
Overflow checking
check.tip: Enable numerics overflow checking

check.label: Suppress all checks
check.tip: Suppress all checks

check.label: Stack checking
check.tip: Generate code to verify that you do not go beyond the boundary of the stack. You should specify this flag if you are running in an environment with multiple threads, but only rarely need to specify it in a single-threaded environment

check.label: Dynamic elaboration
check.tip: Full dynamic elaboration checks

check.label: Debug Information
check.tip: Debug Information

check.label: Enable assertions
check.tip: Assertions enabled. Pragma Assert and pragma Debug are activated

check.label: Ada 83 mode
check.tip: Override the compiler's default, and enforces Ada 83 restrictions

check.label: Ada 95 mode
check.tip: Override the compiler's default, and compile in Ada 95 mode

check.label: Ada 2005 mode
check.tip: Override the compiler's default, and activate Ada 2005 language features

check.label: Store call stack in exceptions
check.tip: Store tracebacks in exception occurrences when the target supports it

check.label: Code coverage
check.tip: Create data files for the gcov code-coverage utility

check.label: Remove unused sections (GNU ld only)
check.tip: Remove all unused sections from the link output. This is a GNU ld switch. See also -ffunction-sections and -fdata-sections compiler flags
